website_summaries.verdict: With hook-and-loop attachment, stake grommets and a 30-pound fill capacity, your canopy isn't going anywhere.
pros: Each bag comes with 2 zippered sections for sand, gravel or other material of your choice
Each pack can hold up to 30 pounds of weight in sand
Each bag has a grommet hole for use with canopy stakes
Each bag seam is double-stitched and comes with a hook-and-loop strap for hold and ease of tying down
cons: May wish to place sand in a plastic bag or bottle before the fabric bag to help keep them clean and reduce wear on bags

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a few weeks, and everything appears to be working great. I used 8 water bottles filled with sand for each Canopy Weight, which hopefully will reduce the amount of leaking sand, and wear and tear on the canvas. -Update 09-01-2017- Still no issues, I attend a farmers market every weekend where these are dropped, strapped, kicked, and on occasion drenched in water. As a helpful tip I suggest putting the sand into plastic bottles, One vendor mentioned that their sandbags have been getting a stagnant odor from the rain once they get damp - which in my case, not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: YOUR CANOPY WONT BLOW AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I've had these bags for about 3 months now, and so far they have been great. I keep my big 13 by 13 canopy up in my backyard 24/7, and so far no problems yet, and it has gone through some pretty good winds. If they last me a complete year I would be well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product if you take your time and fill them right!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I used 2 bags of general purpose sand from Home Depot for the 4 bag set. Each of the bags gas two tubes for sand. I used heavy duty zip lock bags to hold the sand. Basically in each tube there are twp ziplock bags. I used an empty 'Rotelle' can to measure the sand; each ziplock has six slightly rounded cans. I got all of the excess air out of the bags, rolled them into cylinders, and slipped them in the tubes (two ziplocks in each tube). So the nutshell is I used 100# of sand and 16 ziplocks to fill these, and using the ziplocks keeps the sand from leaking and protects the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Gary London

customer_reviews.title: Serve their purpose
customer_reviews.text: Serve their purpose well. I do recommend, like other reviewers, to line the inside with a plastic bag. We didn't do this with the first set so they look a little dusty, but the second set we did and they look much more presentable.
customer_reviews.author: Jelica

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These weight bags are great to hold down a popup tent. They are designed well and are good quality. I have filled mine with pea gravel and used them quite a few times now and they are perfect. I can hang them overhead from my tent and the Velcro straps hold them on securely. I have also sat the bags on the ground and wrapped them on the legs of my tent. The price from this seller is great and i have seen them much more expensive in other stores. This is the place to purchase them. The arrived quick.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B

customer_reviews.title: good design. Bought a 50# bag of all-purpose sand ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Heavy fabric, good design. Bought a 50# bag of all-purpose sand and divided between 8 gallon zip-lock plastic bags. Rolled and inserted in each of the 8 pouches. Used for tailgating this weekend. The four filled bags fit in a milk crate for carrying, storage. Used this weekend for tailgating ahead of a rain storm. Quite windy and the canopy stayed put. Would definitely recommend, especially at the price!
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, unobtrusive looks and can hold quite a bit of weight. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: These arrive empty and you fill with sand, cat litter, pebbles, etc. I saw online someone recommended lining with a medium trash bag before filling to help keep clean and nice, so I did that and it works well. I used sand, so these are quite heavy when filled. I often only use two of them on my tent and they are more than enough to weight it down. A few weeks ago, at a farmer's market, the wind kicked up unexpectedly and a few nearby tents were flipped and damaged. Mine didn't budge. Highly recommended. Looks better than many other weight options that I've seen folks use.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryMaven50

customer_reviews.title: Great additional add on to weights
customer_reviews.text: We are using these as additional add on weights for our canopy at Farmer's Markets. We saw a great idea from another user about filling used water bottles with fish tank sized gravel. After closing them, reinforce with duck tape. each side gets 4 bottles (making it a total of 8 bottles per wight unit) This is a great way instead of using sand directly in the unit....if the sand gets wet it is harder to dry out and can become musty and moldy. We LOVE them !! They are easy to put around each leg of the canopy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lindeman

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I filled these with pea gravel so that if it did get a hole I wouldn't have sand all up in my van. I've used them several times and they work awesome. The zippers are ok and the canvas material doesn't feel extremely durable, but they're dirt cheap so expecting long lasting isn't reasonable. However, they're still kicking and full of rocks! Each bag is easily heavy enough to hold down my popup canopy. Highly recommend giving them a shot. They don't take up a ton of space either. They stay piled up by the tool box in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: sandbags
customer_reviews.text: These sandbags are designed to give stability to the legs of the 13x13 canopy. They wrap around the legs and are secured with heavy velcro straps. Have not slipped off yet. They work exceedingly well and keep the canopy in place in winds and rain. We used a heavy weight garbage bag inside the canvas bags to place the sand in which keeps water out of the sand and has keep the canvas bags in very good shape. The recent tropical storm Michael scared us into taking the canopy down but we used the sandbags then to give some weight to the overturned lawn furniture which helps ride out the storm. Highly recommend these bags.
customer_reviews.author: R L

customer_reviews.title: Let the wind blow!
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a trip to the Colorado River, we spend all day on a sand bar at the river edge. These held a 14’x14’ canopy in place no problem. Winds kick up in the afternoon which in times past has launched canopies into the air and ruined the frames. This year it didn’t budge. The empty bags are light weight and don’t take up any room in the boat. A collapsible camping shovel makes filling a breeze. When it’s time to go just dump out the sand, store the bags in the handy carry tote and you’re on your way! I think I sold three more sets as people marveled at how well they worked.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Short life...
customer_reviews.text: I use these every week, twice a week for Growers Market. I put 10lbs of sand inside individual plastic bags then put those bacgs inside these weight bags for a total of 20lbs per bag. I don't toss them around, I don't drag them, It hasn't been rough weather but yet there is still holes beginning to form on the bottoms and the seams of the Velcro are already snapping. I've only been using them for about three weeks. so I guess I'll use them until they are unusable (which shouldn't be much longer now at this rate) and invest in some more expensive ones that have better quality material and durable stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Willow

customer_reviews.title: Could I just use disposable sand bags?  Sure.  But these are better.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great to hold down a big 13' beach canopy over the long weekend. I'm glad I brought them, because the wind was strong throughout the whole trip, and I don't know if the stakes alone would have held up. They're easy to fill, easy to zip, even when covered and full of sand. Easy to attach to the legs of a canopy. They have a metal grommet that you can run a stake through to hold everything down (though I did notice some corrosion on that after one weekend in the salt & sand). Waxed inside so they're easy to empty and clean. Fold flat and easy to pack away with the canopy for next time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Everyone that uses a pop up shade needs these
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. I put trash bags inside, then filled with sand just to help the sand not to leak out. I had this set up outside my house for 2 weeks while building some furniture for my kids room. We had several days of really gusty wind that made the canopy shake, but not once did it ever come close to coming off the ground. Love the way you can use them around the legs, or up high in the frame. I’d buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guinn

customer_reviews.title: They do the job!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these in June and they have been used everyday since we received them. They have held up thru it all. We live in the high desert and high winds are a constant. I haven't had to worry once about our pop up covering tent taking off. Fill them well...and that thing isn't moving. The tent fabric would shred long before these would budge. They are really faded after one summer outside 24/7, but that has not changed their effectiveness. Would recommend and purchase again. Great product for the price point!
customer_reviews.author: Carris

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Just finished a 3 day Festival and the weight bags worked great. Had some wind and the canopy did not move. We filled them with sand. Have not put them on a scale but guessing they weigh about 20 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can Be Used To Hold Down Fitness/Aerial Equipment Too!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to hold down a swing frame I'm using as a an aerial yoga swing. I filled these weight bags with play sand. Each held only around 30lbs but they seem sturdy and work great. I'm around 135lbs so not sure if they'd be as effective for someone larger. Overall great buy, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent weight holders
customer_reviews.text: I've been using square canvas bags with sand for weights and have jealously eyed people with nice weight bags like these. I've done 2 shows using these eight bags and they worked beautifully. I keep my sand in individual 5 lb ziplock bags, and they should right into the weight holder, very easy to fill & empty. Since these weight holder are vertical, they sit nicely out of the way, no tripping hazards. And they're compact enough that they don't interfer with zipping closed the tent walls. One of the shows had some severe weather with powerful wind gusts, a few people lost tents. But mine held beautifully. I am a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. We’ve been using these on our pop up tent for over a year and they work great. We’ve been to trade shows with crazy winds where other vendors tents would take off (even with weights) and ours stays steady... I have been more than impressed by these. To fill them we put force flex trash bags in the sack, poured playground sand in them, and tied them off. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the product I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: These are working out perfectly, and have been tested in pretty good winds already. I don’t know that I’d trust them in the brutal Santa Ana winds of CA, but in normal wind conditions, these stay put. I used 8 lb. trash bags to line the inside, as a couple reviewers suggested, and divided 2 50-pound bags of sand between them. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Zachy11

customer_reviews.title: LET THE WIND BLOW
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a canopy before and did not use any anchor other than the small ones that came with it. First little wind, and away it went. This year I purchased another canopy, I knew that I had to find something to help and I found the Ohuhu Canopy Weight Bags. What an amazing difference, there have been several rain with heavy winds and my weight bags held my canopy in place, no problem at all. I had filled my bags with leftover bricks and also added play sand. These are a must have for any outdoor fun and will save you money, thanks for such a great product, peeper
customer_reviews.author: peeper

customer_reviews.title: The Best Purchase for the Beach
customer_reviews.text: I have no negatives for this product, and that is extremely unusual. They are crucial for all Cabanas, tents or even umbrellas that already state that they have "sand holders". None of the sand holders that come with these products are sufficient to deal with wind on the beach and leave to tragedy. These sand holders are fabulous. They are heavy, but that is because they are filled with sand. The price is right, the material is heavy and holds a lot of sand, and they save many tears as the cabana, tent or umbrella blow down the beach. Many hearts and flowers for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: The velcro ripped off of one of them quite easily. The seams on two of the weights are ...
customer_reviews.text: Not holding the sand in. The velcro ripped off of one of them quite easily. The seams on two of the weights are leaking sand and are ripped about 3" both sides of the double stitching. Ok for moving them in the back of the truck but not in the car. Not as rugged as the manufacturer claims. Delicate I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Fishboy

customer_reviews.title: Error in order but Amazon fixed it.
customer_reviews.text: Had to make two orders. The first order contained only 1 set of bags so Amazon quickly refunded the order. Happy to report that the 2nd order contained the correct number (4) sets of bags. They arrived very quickly. Haven't used them yet but these seem to be made well with sturdy material. Plan to put plastic bottles of water in tube chambers for weight. Then pour out the water when I disassemble the canopy because it is easier to store empty plastic bottles than heavy sand.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: which has turned out to be an excellent purchase. Due to the heavy winds consideration in ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Sonoma Outdoor Iron Gazebo several months ago, which has turned out to be an excellent purchase. Due to the heavy winds consideration in my canyon, sometimes up to 80mph, we purchased OHUHU Canopy weight bags to secure it. Once again, fantastic product. Absolutely top quality construction and materials and the look of them on each leg is not compromising to the look of the canopy. Buy a bag of sand from Lowes or Home Depot, pour & zip, and you're good to go. These Ohuhu weight bags really secured the canopy beautifully, so well that I didn't even need to stake it! We could not be happier with both of these quality products!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley OHara

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty construction, easy to fill and transport
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few types of canopy weights to keep my canopy grounded at the farmers' markets, and like sand-filled bags the best. These are made of heavy-duty material that stand up making them easy to fill with sand, and the zippers form a no-leak seal. I like that they wrap around each leg and velcro in place easily. When full they are heavy, but the sturdy handles make them relatively easy to lift and move.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: The Best Canopy Weigts on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 sets of the Ohuhu Canopy Weights. I had 2 Canopies in the backyard so I put 1 Weight on the outside legs and 1 Weight on each of the inside legs together. I put sand in empty water bottles, which was perfect weight and size. The materials are extremely durable and top quality. We had 65 mph winds this week and the Canopies stayed in place while everything else in my backyard blew around. I have Turf in my backyard and the weights have not caused any indents in the Turf. The company has 5 Star Customer Service. I had a question and they answered immediately. I highly recommend this company and product.
customer_reviews.author: Calmom5

customer_reviews.title: That works!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently working with my second set of these weight bags. They work very well at securing my canopy in place, and I live in a windy area. My only criticism has to do with their vulnerability to UV. The first set didn't last as long as I had expected. I am now keeping the new set in a storage box large enough to store all 4.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zippers make it unusable for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy these. The zippers are so incredibly cheap, they are worse than what you would find on a child's backpack. They were broken almost immediately. Why on earth would you use cheap zippers on something that is meant to withstand weight?? Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great and keeps your canopy on the ground
customer_reviews.text: If you can't stake your canopy down this is a great alternative. The bags are very strong and durable with good zippers. I loaded mine up with rocks. I put the rocks in ziplock bags then put them in the weight bags. Now my only problem is carrying rock filled bags around, but typically you'd use these if you set up your canopy in a parking lot or on the street and in that case you car is usually close by. If you think you'll need to carry them very far get a small wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to hold down a 10X10 straight leg canopy at the beach - Hilton Head Island, specifically. Worked well for the task. Easy to fill, easy to empty and the canopy didn't budge the entire time at the beach - even with the afternoon ocean wind (which can get pretty strong). Seems sturdy and well made - looks like they'll last. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CHC

customer_reviews.title: Great product, affordable solution!
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to fill and very affordable at $17 for 4. Bought 200 pounds of sand to fill to max 40 lbs/bag, 160 lbs for all 4. Heavy duty material, very little sand leakage when left out in the rain. I would definitely recommend! update 8/2017: all the grommets rusted and stained my concrete. if you don't need them, cut them off. Removed one star.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised. Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: The bags appear to be well made. We couldn't get them filled with enough weight for the requirements we were supposed to have for a festival, but nobody came walking around to weigh the bags. The people next to us also had these. They said they bought little river rocks and filled the bags with them, THEN, they poured in the sand and were able to get them to about 25 pounds. So, we will likely do the same for the next time we need them. They attached easily and looked just fine on the legs of tent. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these maybe a year ago and they hold my 10x10 canopy very well! My small business travels everywhere, selling at local festivals. Sometimes it's nice and sunny, sometimes it's rainy and windy ~ no matter the weather, these have held up VERY well. I filled them with sand ~ it doesn't leak! The handle is sturdy and is easy for me to grip and move them. They're super easy to attach, it's like putting little velcro shoes on your tent legs haha I feel at ease knowing my tent won't budge in the wind. ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Melissa W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I lost my canopy during the storm with another type of weight. I replaced the canopy and bought these weight bags. You hardly know they are on the legs of the tent. So far on the last windy day the canopy has not moved since I put these on. They were very easy to fill with sand and definitely heavy enough to hold it down. I am so glad I ordered them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE VERY WELL, ZIPPERS WOULDN'T WORK DUE TO STITCHING
customer_reviews.text: All of the product seemed to be good until I went to zip up the bags and the zippers on top were not made properly, the sewing was terrible, I could not close the bags. Who ever sewed the zippers did a POOR JOB. Couldn't even use them.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Don't weight (get it, LOL) Get these bags now, they are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These things are worth more then what they actually cost! I just came back from a trip to Destin, Florida and these things worked like a charm. Being on the beach, the wind was usually hovering around 10 mph, not a biggie. However a couple times, the weather did get nasty and at one point, we had sustained 25+ mph winds for at least 30 minutes. I saw several tents go flying, but ours stayed put! These bags look great, are very durable and are built great. Would recommend them to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: We had a pretty major storm come through this past weekend, with sustained wind gusts from 35-45 mph for about 12 hours. I had these attached to my little 10x10 pop-up canopy, and they were filled with white landscaping rock, so they weren't even as heavy as they would have been with sand. The wind did its best, but the the next morning my canopy hadn't moved an inch. I'm probably going to end up buying some more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: There is also a zipper which I like. You can either fill up the two side ...
customer_reviews.text: We live in FL and go to the beach often. Many times it gets a little windy. I looked at a lot of items for our new canopy to make it more secure. These are perfert! They are very well made, heavy material. There is also a zipper which I like. You can either fill up the two side with sand directly or you can do what I did and that is use a 2 liter plastic bottle and fill it with sand. Fists perfectly in each pocket. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Rowan

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job! Used these for my 10x10 canopy under 20 mph wind and they held it down really well on full bags. The only issue is they need better quality zippers because sand leaks through on 2 of my bags at the end of the zipper. If the bags are held and stored upright the sand won't leak but if it's lying sideways the sand leaks at the end of the zipper. Other than that, the material is heavy duty and they'll hold down well.
customer_reviews.author: TRENT M. H

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have a temporary cover that I needed to be held down as wind would easily knock down the cover if it weren't weighted down. I bought several bags of pea gravel for a couple of bucks. Loaded each of these with about forty pounds of gravel and strapped them onto the legs. Powerful winds were not able move my cover. Excellent product. Nice, thick bags, strong zippers, strong straps.
customer_reviews.author: toobig4u

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I needed something to weigh them down with, last minute, so I bought a big case of water bottles and put 2 in each compartment. It did the trick. We even saw someone struggling with a light weight tent at an event we were at...so we went to the car and let them borrow our weights. Solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Masala Cha

customer_reviews.title: does the job... but some of the zippers fail ...
customer_reviews.text: does the job...but the zippers fail and leak sand. Update... they contacted me and sent me 6 replacement bags... On first glance the zippers and stitching look the same...These do not leak sand but that seams to be because of better QC filtering rather than improved design... they really do need a better zipper and better stitching...but given the great customer service I am raising the rating to 4 stars because in the end they were a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B

customer_reviews.title: Put a 2 liter bottle full of sand in it.
customer_reviews.text: I have these out on my boat dock, One night a storm came through and tossed the entire canopy into the lake, While these didn't hold it in place (There was 40MPh winds that night) they held up great being tossed around. I've since used them several times during calmer times and they hold the tent down and in place. Be sure to use 2 liter bottles full of sand in the pockets. the bottles help keep things clean.
customer_reviews.author: Paul k

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight bags
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for any canopy that has a small triangle foot on the legs, or used with a bungie cord without. They are very easy to fill and use. Word of advice: Fill with landscape gravel (not sand, as it leaks from seams) and let settle for a fe uses. You'll be able to put another few inches of gravel in then. Each leg bag (two containers) holds about 25 pounds of gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and fit around legs.  Are heavy when filled up, I used pea-gravel
customer_reviews.text: One thing I especially like was when it came time to take my canopy down, by leaving weight on one leg I was able to fold down the canopy by myself. They have a carry strap, zippered closed and seem durable. Carrying 2 at once to keep balanced is a little too much weight, make 4 trips and save your hip/knees or whatever is ailing you.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Ohuhu Canopy Weight Bags
customer_reviews.text: "Tie me Kangaroo down" - These Ohuhu Canopy Weight Bags simply, Work. They even have built in spike rings on an extended tab at the bottom, for that extra hold down effect. Used with a collapsable canopy, saddle a couple on overhead canopy braces gives extra stability also. They also have a strong carry loop, and wide velcro strap to secure the bags around anything you put them on.
customer_reviews.author: cyn

customer_reviews.title: Very effective! Worked great for our pop up gazebo
customer_reviews.text: These sand bag weights are amazing! Ordered these for a pop up gazebo that is kept on the patio. Filled ziplock bags with sand, and then placed the bags inside, based on other reviews we had seen. Very effective on those breezy days. So glad we ordered them...look a whole lot better than the cement block option we had considered for anchoring legs to the gazebo tent for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seem like a good product and I was pleased that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Seem like a good product and I was pleased that it could hold up to 40 pounds. I only loaded them to between 25 and 30 pounds and on the first outing one of the four bags split at the seam in the other seem ready to go as well. Returning them and found a heavier duty product to replace these
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: I'm actually not using it to hold down a tent ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually not using it to hold down a tent; I live in a high rise and my patio furniture was a bit too light and the wind would blow it around. Instead of buying new chairs and table, I was hoping the weights would be enough to hold it down during high winds. I've had it for a few months and there's been some very serious storms and so far it's kept the furniture in place. The only complaint is that I wish the straps were longer but that's probably because I'm using it to hold down something other than a tent pole.
customer_reviews.author: kgp

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zippers!
customer_reviews.text: I took these bags out of their wrappers for the very first time and several of the zippers that close the bag channels broke IMMEDIATELY. Tough to hold sand with cheap, broken zippers. Awful construction and totally useless. Move on in your search.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, but all the stitching on carrying straps has ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, but all the stitching on carrying straps has torn out. They also leak sand awfully bad. After sharing my experience, I was contacted for a refund or replacement right away. I wasn't expecting it and really appreciate the great customer service. If you have any issues, be sure to contact the seller for help!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Willard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: We are currently riding out the tail end of Tropical Storm Cindy in the Florida panhandle. We had these weights on the tent on Sunday with great success but they are really being put to the test today with 20+ mph winds. Doing a great job. We don't even have our tent tethered down. The sand bags are awesome. Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: 40east

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great for leg weights for a popup shade. I used liter water bottles, two for each leg of the popup. Water seems so much easier than sand. Some reviewers complained of broken zippers. Actually, the zippers seem to arrive in a halfway position, with the two sides not quite together. Simply completely unzip the top and then zip closed. The teeth will then link appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These were great. I did try putting sand in gallon ziplock bags to help with the durability. However if you fill the gallon bag full, it won’t fit into the sand bangs... maybe two quart size for each side of each bag would work better. However, we just filled them half full and they still held down our tent.
customer_reviews.author: STACY A PERRY

customer_reviews.title: perfect for outside street fairs
customer_reviews.text: These kept my tent from blowing away in Kansas's (literally) 30 mile an hour winds (with 40 mile gusts). The fabric and seams are very thin, you can actually see through the seams, so to contain a mess I filled bags with sand instead of pouring straight in. Carry handle seems very strong.
customer_reviews.author: ThatPhotoChick

customer_reviews.title: These don't last long. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to put on the bottom of a 10x10 canopy. They lasted like 10 events and now two of them have busted open from the sides. They were leaking from the beginning but I decided to deal with it. The Velcro doesn't hold very well either so on many occasions I got sand all in my car. These aren't long lasting and you should spend your money on something better.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: The velcrow will rip after few uses
customer_reviews.text: They need to use strong stitching esp. where the Velcro is. The thread is not strong, and the stitch isn't; either. So if you hold the Velcro and tug, it rips easily. This product would be great, if they used strong thread and reinforced stitching.
customer_reviews.author: TonyP

customer_reviews.title: but they're still not bad to look at
customer_reviews.text: We contemplated buying the typical 5 pound weights that you see at Dick's or Academy but at only 5 pounds? How well can they hold the gusts of wind we get here in Texas? Anyway we sought out something more and found these. Our 13 x 13 canopy has leg skirts so no issues with the look of these weight bags, but they're still not bad to look at. As far as quality they're Better than expected. Fill them half way fill them all the way. If the wind picks up your canopy with these attached, then you should Not be outdoors! No worries, try a set!
customer_reviews.author: Drew De Marco

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Woke up to find hurricane isaias battering outside. But my cheap 10x10 pop up canopy was still hilsing strong with its leg weights. I watched it for a good 30 min it was shaking a little bit but never lifted or moved. Would highly recommend for any canopy. I put pea gravel inside
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bell

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased so far. A good price and they seem well enough put together. I filled each pocket with two 5lb Ziplock bags full of pea gravel so 4 bags (20lb) per corner which seems a good compromise between weight and portability. The spec claims that each 'corner' can take 40lb. I could probably have got up to 30lb with the gravel but you would have to go for something denser if you wanted to get up to 40lb. Fitted round the legs of our canopy no problem as you would expect and our one experience so far was good in winds up to about 15-20 mph.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution, and so much better-looking than most solutions I have seen in the past.
customer_reviews.text: These are a real bargain for the quality and design that went into their construction. Work like a charm on my pop-up tent, and very easy to attach and remove to tent legs. Easy to transport as well, with built in carry-straps.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.P.

customer_reviews.title: That’s San keeps pouring out.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible the sand keeps coming out I’ve just used it to her three times and every time I use it to Sam keeps coming out the zipper works but it still opens as you move the sandbag. Really upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and work well!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and did the job exactly as expected! We went to the lake with some friends and family and I was so thankful I had purchased these! We live in Arizona, and if you know Arizona weather, we are prone to dust devils which are little sand storms. Our friends had the exact same canopy as we did but did not purchase any weights...needless to say as soon as the sand storm came through, their canopy went flying and ours stood like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Maile N Meno

customer_reviews.title: Great investment! I've used these the past 2 weekends ...
customer_reviews.text: Great investment! I've used these the past 2 weekends now on my craft show tent and they've done a great job. I no longer get nervous whenever the breeze picks up! I filled them with pea gravel. Each has a good weight to it and have helped keep my 10x10 tent super sturdy even without using stakes into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy weights but zipper part needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We used 6 bags on a 10x20 canopy. Held canopy down well on a windy day. The only thing is the sand would spill out of zipper opening when moving them so you need to make sure the the zippers are closed good. That's the only problem I had with them. There is a handle on them that makes it easy to carry/transport.
customer_reviews.author: Girl_Hula

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for our use
customer_reviews.text: I decided to use 1.5 liter water bottles filled with gravel as the weight for these bags. The bottles fit perfectly and the bags stay clean. I use two of the bags as extra weight for my outdoor movie screen. They are super quick to hook to the screen thanks to the Velcro strap. They also have a carrying strap which makes them easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of weight bags. They are sturdy. I fill with rocks and use them weekly for outdoor farmers market tent. The first set held up for four years. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn D

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at the beach
customer_reviews.text: We used these this past week on the beach and they worker very good. They’re easy to fill with sand. The kids loved filling them up. My only concerns with them are the zippers can be tricky to pull when sand is involved. Also, I’m not sure how secure they’ll actually be if the wind really picked up. All in all I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little sandbags that look good too.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for holding down my carport canopy. It stayed put during a strong wind last month when a neighbor lost his unsecured canopy. I like the zipper closure. The sandbags that close with Velcro don’t always stay closed.
customer_reviews.author: Annemmel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My only complaint is that they say they hold 40 lbs. I fit as much sand into them as I could, weighed them on my bathroom scale, and they weighed 35 lbs. Maybe...just maybe....I could have fit a little bit more sand in, but there is no way I could have fit 5 more lbs in. Other than that, they work great. The strapped to my tents legs perfectly, and they looked more professional than the pvc weights that i saw other people with.
customer_reviews.author: James B Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Good Construction, Zipper Tops, Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: These weight bags seem to be well constructed with zipper tops. I can opt to slide a concrete cylinder in it or just put some good old sand in it. Some of the others I've seen have straps included that can attach to the top of canopy, these do not. Canvas seems to be of reasonable duty, don't appear to want to give out immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Pignutr

customer_reviews.title: Great bags, hold a lot of sand
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these bags to secure a new carport we purchased. We filled the bags up with two 50 pound bags of sand and distributed them throughout all 4 bags and 100 lbs fit perfectly. Make sure if you use sand to lift and drop the bags as your filling it up with sand to compress the sand down in each bag. See my photos to see how they look.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan T.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my carport I put up. I took the advice of other reviewers and put 8 gallon trash bags inside to hopefully keep these from wearing out and protect the sand from getting wet. So far so good. We'll see how they hold up when we get some strong winds blowing through!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to weigh down popups in extreme weather
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these - after having an EZ-Up flip upside down and fly away while camping in the desert (DESPITE leg weights), I knew I needed something good to weigh it down. They hold a TON of dirt or sand or whatever material you're using and I haven't had any issues weighing down a pop-up since. Make sure you bring some sort of shovel or trowel to help direct the material INTO these, because the opening is kind of small, so without a proper tool, it's hard to get the material in there. A++ product!
customer_reviews.author: Arcangela Miceli

customer_reviews.title: Wish they came w a funnel or easy way to fill
customer_reviews.text: Wish they came w a funnel or easy way to fill. If they do, I haven’t discovered it yet! Stoked to have these help w my patio umbrella, my canopy and tent and other stuff I’m sure it will help with. Windy situations are the worst, stakes don’t always work depending on the territory. Weight bags are awesome
customer_reviews.author: Bakoro

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BAGS
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these bags are AMAZING !!!!! We were at the beach parking lot all weekend and with Florida pending storms in the afternoon, the days were quite windy. I purchase 12 (3 sets) and was able to use these with 2-3 tents together. We filled them up with beach sand using 2 (1) gallon ziplock bags in each cylinder. There is several different ways to use these bags as shown. With Travel baseball season here, I will be getting a lot of use out of these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! Everyone asks where we got them
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Everyone asks where we got them. We did put the sand/stone mixture in heavy duty plastic bags before putting them into the Weight Bags. Lasted a full year of car shows and still work great! Might get a second set just in case one fails! Great investment!!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great for large tents
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I did not like was it was very hard to fill the bag alone, you have to pour and hold the heavy bag at the same time, if someone is helping it is no problem, bags do an excellent job of holding down the tents
customer_reviews.author: greg grant

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I think I like these so much because you can use just about anything in the area as weight in the bags & don't have to lug around the amount of weights it would take to secure a canopy safely. They are slim & when empty fold right up & fit in the canopy bag, plus the seller got them here super fast. Happy girl right here :-D
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Love

customer_reviews.title: which support a Skill grinder (course / fine wheels); a Skill grinder (wire-brush / buffing wheel)
customer_reviews.text: Product is as advertised - I, however - have repurposed the set (filled with sand), for use as extra weights on: 4x WEN steel pedestals, which support a Skill grinder (course / fine wheels); a Skill grinder (wire-brush / buffing wheel); a third, a small WEN drill press; and a fourth, as a support for a small Anvil. Works! Didn't want to "bolt" the four pedestals to the floor - this "trick" allows me to move 'em around!
customer_reviews.author: Spirit the Magician

customer_reviews.title: Strong, secure canopy weight bag - Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to hold down my canopy. Each dual weight bag is made of a very heavy "canvas" like material. I has a a very large velcro strap to attach the weight bags to the canopy support legs. There is a strap with a grommet attached to the bags to allow for a stake to provide additional protection. It also has a strap attached to the bags to carry the weight bags. These are made to last!!! I am extremely pleased with this product from OHUHU.
customer_reviews.author: SKYGUY

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any canopy owner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my canopy. Just be sure to get the sand or dirt FIRST!! Or the sake of ease, keep the sand or Dirt in a bucket or jars for transport. Don't keep it in the bags, as mold & mildew can start to form on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lsd

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid construction. Zippers and stitching all seem to be well done. I think these should last quite awhile. Some other reviews I've read about falling apart seem to come from people throwing these while filled and expecting the seams to hold up. As far as I can see these are put together very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jory Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are terrific. Fill them with free (or cheap) sand and they will hold down your canopy. Highly recommended when you are setting your canopy up on pavement. Very sturdy. When you're done, dump the sand and you've got flat bags again so they take up no room in your car. Look really good too. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Great solution, works better for me than stakes
customer_reviews.text: I filled these with playground sand from the big box hardware store. They work better than the skinny stakes I had been using to hold down my EZ-UP, which wanted to pull out of the ground on their own. I'd say that filled with sand, they probably weigh about 35 pounds each, maybe 40.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Bags are solid but the zippers are horrible. 4 of the eight pouches busted open. I sewed them up with fishing string Update: After writing this review the company reached out to me and offered to replace the defective product. I am upping my rating for the customer service and the zippers on the replacement are working like they should. Great company and would defiantly buy again and recommend them as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use a garbage bag with them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and another brand at the same time. These really are made better and hold more sand. Someone recommended lining them with a small trash bag and tying it off first. I highly recommend doing this. When you go to throwing these into a vehicle the velcro will come loose at least a little. If you have your sand in a garbage bag, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these weight bags! They wrapped perfectly around my canopy legs and secured with the attached Velcro. No need to fuss with tie downs or rope for securing. They hold a tremendous amount of sand and are so heavy individually that I have no doubt my canopy is secure. Absolutely recommend! I placed a small bag inside then filled it with sand and secured it closed with tape so the sand doesn't seep out. Very happy with my purchase and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Code Alpha

customer_reviews.title: A must have for canopies if outside in a windy day!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously will not come filled in with sand, just go to local home depot and buy some kid play sad and fill in. I will say that the sand will leak out a little from the top (zipper) area when laying on its side but other than that the sand doesn't come out.
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Canopy Weight bags
customer_reviews.text: They appear to work well. I filled them up with sand and placed them around the legs of our gazebo. The velcro strap ripped about an inch as i opened the bag to put sand in it. I figure it still velcros and didn't feel like making a fuss for one bag. They seem quite sturdy otherwise. We'll see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: tbk03

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably solid construction
customer_reviews.text: The bags are pretty good. They appear sturdy and the velcro is strong but very little attention was done on keeping sand from escaping by the zipper. It doesn't pour out, but any movement will cause some sand to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These weights are perfect for my Under Cover canopy
customer_reviews.text: These weights are perfect for my Under Cover canopy! I filled gallon sized zip lock bags with sand (about halfway full) and put those in the opening. It takes 2 of those per weight. There was a little empty space at the top so I filled a quart sized zip lock with sand and placed those on top. It took about 2 bags of sand (50 pounds each) to completely fill these weights. I live in the windy midwest and my tent is nice and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things are great!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! We bought these for a 4 leg canopy for a trip to the beach. The wind was HOWLING hard. when these are filled with sand they were plenty heavy enough to keep the legs in place. Totally blow away about how well they worked. We dumped the sand out afterwards and folded them up. Easy peazy!
customer_reviews.author: r570sv

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These weight bags are absolutely amazing. We've had some pretty rough storms with very high winds lately. The weight bags held the canopy down, jumped around a tad, but stayed put. We filled ours with pebble stone in plastic bags. Would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Riehle

customer_reviews.title: Work great for pop up canopy
customer_reviews.text: These worked great to stabilize our shaky pop up canopy. Used plastic bags in them and filled with 25 lbs of pea gravel each.
customer_reviews.author: zerbit

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: We use these weights to hold down our tent at the farmer's market. Easy to use. Thick, durable material. My only "regret" is that the Velcro fastener straps are not sewn well to the fabric. After a couple uses, the stitching on one of the fastener straps ripped.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our week at the beach!
customer_reviews.text: We used these with our Quest 10x10 canopy during a week at the beach. Despite strong winds on some days, our canopy didn't come up off the ground at all like it has in previous years. I didn't have any issues with the seams ripping, the velcro breaking, or the zippers malfunctioning. I thought these were priced really reasonably and were much easier to deal with than some other canopy weight solutions like the big weighted plates.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great weights
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality construction of these bags. They fit well around the canopy legs and hang well also. Bought two extra sets so I won't be without!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Jones

customer_reviews.title: A must have to go with any canopy. Used ...
customer_reviews.text: A must have to go with any canopy. Used these at the beach, emptied the sand at the end of the trip, folded these beauties up packed up ready to go the next time. used 4 long bungee cords and they held our KingKong canopy solid as Gibraltar. A++++ in my book
customer_reviews.author: Bham Man

product_meta.title: Ohuhu Canopy Weight Bags for Pop up Canopy Tent, Sand Bags for Instant Outdoor Sun Shelter Canopy Legs, 4-Pack (Bags Only, Sand Not Included)
feature_bullets: ☘️ DUAL-ZIPPER COMPARTMENTS: Each bag comes with two zippered sections for sand, gravel or any preferred contents
☘️ 30 LB WEIGHT: Each pack can hold up to a maximum of 30 lbs (13.6kg) of weight in sand, rock, dirt and other contents
☘️ EXTREME CONDITIONS USE: Each bag is equipped with a hook for nail or peg (not included) to withstand high wind, and other natural weather elements
☘️ TWO-CYLINDER BAG: Each bag seam is double-stitched for durability, and comes with one Velcro strap for hold and ease of use for tying down
☘️ HIGH QUALITY MATERIAL: Created with 600D oxford fabric for high quality and built to last. ▲▲***NOTE*** Filler is not included ▲▲

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,240 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
